title: Who gains by deconstructing Reality? Symbol v. Cliche, Mind/Brain connection
description:
Confronting Reality vs. Retreating into Isolation

Information only becomes knowledge once it is lived out so that it can be determined to be true or false.  Our world today is awash in information, and the technologically connected are absorbing information at a dizzying pace, but not living it out, so there is no way to make sense of whether the information accords with reality.  We discuss this issue from the standpoint of symbol and quantum mechanics.

Symbol is a coming together of heaven and earth (Jonathan Pageau on archetypes)
Even words themselves are symbols.  Our human bodies are symbols.

A symbol is a data structure that allows us to get information into small enough slots to absorb and to survive over time (MIchael)

That which you cannot articulate shows up in symbol.

Constant flow of information has become chaotic and to a great extent, we’ve lost the symbolic language that we used to all have in common (Alex)

The iPhone generation speaks to each other in memes and gifs.  That allows them to share large quantities of information about perspectives and emotional responses without ever having to articulate the perspective or access the emotional response.  This results in a lack of vulnerability and a lack of commitment to action. (Michael)

Richard Mitchell, The Graves of Academe, on the degradation of language into bureaucratese resulting in ambiguity and the passive voice so there is no agency, no one responsible. (KW)

Steve Wolfram put together simple rules and initial conditions of all particles

Are symbols emergent manifestations of shared experience or
Do symbols emanate, give something, more akin to imagination or an experience of the numinous? (Alex)

Symbols can have a life of their own.  Barfield said words can have souls that contain within them the built up meaning of history over time. (Michael)

Current scientific atmosphere is leading to reductionism, atomizing reality so that we are 
Losing the truth of objective meaning. 

Modern symbols represent the new banal ambiguity. (Alex)

Truth.  You can’t have an intention to know truth unless you believe that truth is real.
If physicists no longer pursue truth or reality, what keeps them moving forward?
Pursuit of godlike powers of knowledge and control (Michael)

When you encounter the transcendent, you can’t help but become aware of your own deficiency, but that also opens up a huge landscape of possibility.  Contra, when you feel the lack of meaning and are falling into the abyss of meaninglessness, you also experience a vulnerability that opens you up to being rescued.

That abyss is the reciprocal narrowing G. K. Chesterton talked about (the insane man can’t get away from himself because his circle is too small - the absolute certainty that he is right).
When we come near God, we get a sense of what we are and who He is.

The liminal space of being between past and the future, in the now, is an experience of consciousness.  God’s concern is for humans to have only two concerns, now & etermity.
The demons want us to focus on the past and on the future.

Is general AI coming?  Not very likely. But even AI as it exists carries dangers if used as an aid in governance (infinite loops, etc.)

Japanese Anime - Psycho-pass
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psycho-Pass
Looks like you can watch it with a subscription to Hulu for free, or you can purchase episode on Amazon Prime.


Eleonor Stump
How Does God Relate to Time:  https://youtu.be/J_rWmxY9YY0
What is God’s Eternity? https://youtu.be/gb718z6aluY
How Free is God?  https://youtu.be/e37UTv6RS5k

Mind and the Wave Function Collapse with John Hagelin and Henry Stapp
https://youtu.be/hSv0NLSCEYo

John Lennox:  Should we Fear AI?  https://youtu.be/njU4u2hMFnE
